page.title: 03COASTAL DEFENCES
page.content: There are coastal defences both at Bee Sands and Torcross, the former being mainly of large boulders, but the latter is a concrete sea wall. The coastal defences have had to be replaced a number of times this century alone. A storm on the 26th January 1917 destroyed the defences and the village of Hallsands. Again in 1951 the defences at Torcross were ruined and a repeat occurred in January 1979 when half a million pounds of damage was done to Torcross alone. This lead to a new concrete wall being built on piles which have been sunk deep into the shingle.
